past simple and past participle of
surf
surf verb [I or T]
(INTERNET)
A2 to spend time visiting a lot of websites: He spends a lot of time surfing the internet/Net/Web.
More examplesFewer examplesJane's been surfing the Web all morning.I spent hours surfing the Web, searching for information.

surf verb [I or T]
(WAVES)
B1 to ride on a wave as it comes towards land, while standing or lying on a special board: They go surfing every weekend. See also
bodysurf
windsurfing
More examplesFewer examplesThe ads feature a montage of images - people surfing, playing football and basketball.For me, nothing compares with the thrill of surfing - it's better than sex.We surfed the biggest waves ever on that beach.
